a reflecting surface originally of polished metal but now usu. of glass with a silvery, metallic or amalgam backing; a mirror.
an idol (as of a deity).
the vine Coccina cordifolia ( = C. indica, = Bryonia grandis, = Momordica monadelpha) of Cucurbitaceae family.
its edible fruit.

the lizard Calotes veriscolar of Chamaeleontidae family with an angular head, prehensile tail, eyes that move independently of each other, a long, agile tongue for catching prey, the ability to change skin colour rapidly; common chameleon; the garden lizard.
a ray of light.
the sky.
water falling from the clouds; rain.
a bow or arc of prismatic colours appearing in the heavens opposite the sun and caused by the refraction and reflection of the suṇs rays in drops of rain; a rainbow.
a woven fabric.
a farming of a picture in the mind based on what one heard about.

a boxlike device for holding a film or plate sensitive to light, having an aperture controlled by a shutter that, when opened, admits light enabling an object to be focused, usu. by means of a lens, on the film or plate, thereby producing a photographic image; a camera.
= ಬಿಂಬಗ್ರಾಹಕ.
the relation between an object and its image in a mirror.
(rhet.) a kind of figure of speech, in which relation similar to this is used to show the resemblence and contrast between two things compared with each other.
the edible fruit of the vine Coccina cordifolia ( = C. indica, = Bryonia grandis, = Momordica monadelpha) of Cucurbitaceae family.
= ಬಿಂಬಫಲ.
the Tree Averrohoa bilimbi of Oxalidaceae family; sorrel tree.
one of the twenty eight Śaivāgamas (holy scriptures).
a lip that is as red as the fruit of Coccina cordifolia.
a woman whose lips are as red as the fruit of Coccina cordifolia, hence beautiful.
reflected in a mirror.
to reflect (an image of an object) 2) to give a form, shape etc. to one's thoughts, schemes, intention, etc.
to make clear or evident to the eye or the understanding; to manifest.
to come to be seen or perceived; to appear.
= ಬಿಂಬಾಧರ.
= ಬಿಂಬಾಧರೆ.
= ಬಿಂಬಾಧರೆ.
= ಬಿಕನಾಸಿ1.
= ಬಿಕನಾಸಿ2.
trifling; insignificant; unimportant; trivial.
he who leads a greedy but wretched life.
the act of exchanging a thing for an agreed sum of money; a selling; a sale.
he who sells; a seller; a merchant.
a person who begs, asks for charity or who lives by begging; a mendicant; a beggar.
the act of begging or state of being a beggar.
exreme poverty; wretchedness.
